instructions: Open StepsApp. Click on Settings . Click on My phone stopped counting steps . Click on Settings . Click on the top right arrow. Open All Apps . Click on StepsApp . Choose Battery optimization . Disable battery optimization. Restart your phone
Open Settings on your device. Click on Apps . Choose Manage Apps . Click on StepsApp . Find Autostart . Enable Allow Apps to start automatically . Restart your device.
Please open StepsApp. Go to Settings. Click the cell "body measurements". Find cell step length and adjust your own step length .
Please open StepsApp. Open Settings. Find cell Unit (metric/imperial) and tap on the unit you prefer
Find the StepsApp icon on your phone. Long press on the icon. Click Pause App . As soon as the app is paused, the icon shows up in gray
On your Android device, open your Settings . Tap Apps & notifications and then Special app access and then Battery optimization and then Messages and then Don't Optimize .

Update your Messages app and your Carrier Services from Play Store. Make sure your Messages app is set as your default SMS app. If your device has dual SIM slots, and both SIMs are inserted, make sure your Call SIM is configured as your Data SIM. On your Android device, open your Settings. Tap Network and Internet. Make sure your Call SIM is configured as Data.
On your Android device, open your Settings. Tap Network and Internet. Make sure your Call SIM is configured as Data.

Go to Menu and then Settings and then Chat features . Tap RETRY and confirm your phone number when requested. Google will send an SMS to confirm your phone number. Make sure you can receive SMS messages.
